coreValues.name: Spirituality
coreValues.desc: Feeling lost in a sea of faces? We are your spiritual home away from home. Together, we'll ensure you continue staying strong in Deen.

coreValues.name: Intellectuality
coreValues.desc: “Allah has prescribed excellence in everything.” Our well-structured programs are will help you achieve excellence in your academics and other aspects of life.

coreValues.name: Morality
coreValues.desc: We believe that Morality is more than just a value. This is why our activities are curated to also help Muslim students maintain a strong moral compass that aligns perfectly with the core principles of Islam.

FAQs.A: MSSN Unilag stands for the Muslim Students Society of Nigeria, University of Lagos branch. It is an organization dedicated to promoting the spiritual, intellectual, and moral development of Muslim students on campus.

FAQs.Q: How can I join MSSN Unilag?
FAQs.A: Joining MSSN Unilag is easy! Simply attend our meetings or programs, and register as a member during any of our events. You can also contact us through our website or social media platforms for more information.

FAQs.Q: What types of programs does MSSN Unilag offer?
FAQs.A: MSSN Unilag offers a wide range of programs, including regular study sessions, weekly discussions, adhoc events, and spiritual retreats. Our programs are designed to enrich the spiritual, intellectual, and moral growth of our members.

FAQs.Q: How can I contribute to MSSN Unilag?
FAQs.A: Contributions to MSSN Unilag can be made in various ways, such as participating in our programs, volunteering for events, and paying annual dues. Your support helps us continue to provide valuable resources and activities for our members

FAQs.Q: Who can I contact for more information or assistance?
FAQs.A: For more information or assistance, you can reach out to our staff adviser or any member of the executive team. Contact details are available on our website s Contact Us page.

body.value: University of Lagos Central Mosque, University of Lagos, Akoka, Lagos State, Nigeria.
